      program combined
      implicit none

      ! ... (all the variables) ...

      integer :: n
      integer(8) :: dp(0:100, 0:3, 0:3, 0:3)
      integer(8) :: res1, total
      integer :: i, a, b, c, d
      character(len=20) :: str1   ! 20 to be safe for numbers up to 10^9 (10 digits)
      integer :: str1_len
      character(len=20) :: temp_str2  ! we'll build the second program's output here
      integer :: out_len
      logical :: s_flag
      character(len=20) :: str3   ! for the third program input, we'll assign the output of the second
      character :: last_char, ch
      integer :: j
      logical :: found

      ! Read n
      read(*,*) n

      ! Initialize dp
      dp = 0
      dp(0, 3, 3, 3) = 1

      ! Iterate for length from 0 to n-1
      do i = 0, n-1
        do a = 0, 3
          do b = 0, 3
            do c = 0, 3
              if (dp(i, a, b, c) == 0) cycle
              do d = 0, 3
                if (isForbidden(a, b, c, d)) cycle
                ! Update state (b, c, d) at length i+1
                dp(i+1, b, c, d) = mod(dp(i+1, b, c, d) + dp(i, a, b, c), MOD)
              end do
            end do
          end do
        end do
      end do

      total = 0
      do a = 0, 3
        do b = 0, 3
          do c = 0, 3
            total = mod(total + dp(n, a, b, c), MOD)
          end do
        end do
      end do
      res1 = total

      ! Convert res1 to a string in str1
      write(str1, '(I0)') res1
      str1_len = len_trim(str1)   ! get the length without trailing spaces

      ! Now, run the second program on the string str1(1:str1_len)
      out_len = 0
      s_flag = .false.
      temp_str2 = ''   ! initialize

      do i = 1, str1_len
        if (str1(i:i) == '.') then
            if (s_flag) then
                out_len = out_len + 1
                temp_str2(out_len:out_len) = '1'
                s_flag = .false.
            else
                out_len = out_len + 1
                temp_str2(out_len:out_len) = '0'
            end if
        else
            if (s_flag) then
                out_len = out_len + 1
                temp_str2(out_len:out_len) = '2'
                s_flag = .false.
            else
                s_flag = .true.
            end if
        end if
      end do

      ! Now, the third program: input is the string temp_str2(1:out_len)
      found = .false.
      last_char = ' '

      do j = out_len, 1, -1
        ch = temp_str2(j:j)
        if (ch /= ' ' .and. ch /= '?') then
            last_char = ch
            found = .true.
            exit
        end if
      end do

      if (.not. found) then
        last_char = ' '
      end if

      ! Convert last_char to lowercase if it is uppercase
      if (last_char >= 'A' .and. last_char <= 'Z') then
          ch = char(ichar(last_char) - ichar('A') + ichar('a')
      else
          ch = last_char
      end if

      if (ch == 'a' .or. ch == 'e' .or. ch == 'i' .or. ch == 'o' .or. ch == 'u' .or. ch == 'y') then
          write(*,*) 'YES'
      else
          write(*,*) 'NO'
      end if

      contains

        logical function isForbidden(a, b, c, d)
          integer, intent(in) :: a, b, c, d
          isForbidden = .false.
          if ( (a==0 .and. b==2 .and. c==1) .or. (b==0 .and. c==2 .and. d==1) ) then
            isForbidden = .true.
          else if ( (b==0 .and. a==2 .and. c==1) .or. (a==0 .and. c==2 .and. d==1) ) then
            isForbidden = .true.
          else if ( (a==0 .and. c==2 .and. b==1) .or. (c==0 .and. b==2 .and. d==1) ) then
            isForbidden = .true.
          else if ( (a==0 .and. b==2 .and. d==1) .or. (b==0 .and. d==2 .and. c==1) ) then
            isForbidden = .true.
          end if
        end function isForbidden

      end program combined
